head.supplied: 2/10/84 ¶ ¶ This afternoon, dear Mr Wadsworth, I went with Mrs Dr Büttner ¶ to wait on Lady Loch, and her Ladyship referred in her conversation to the Eucalypts, and had branches of them in Vases. T...

div.p: P84/2857, unit 41, VPRS 1163/P1 inward correspondence, VA 1123 Premier, Public Record Office, Victoria.

This afternoon, dear Mr Wadsworth, I went with Mrs Dr Büttner
Henriette Büttner, wife of Alexander Büttner. to wait on Lady Loch, and her Ladyship referred in her conversation to the Eucalypts, and had branches of them in Vases. This reminds me, that his Excellency would likely be interested in my Eucalyptography , and perhaps a copy could be got through the hon. the Premier for the Governor.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
The 10th Decade of the Eucalyptography is just completed.
B84.08.05. Wadsworth sent the suggestion to E. Thomas, Secretary to the Premier, who in turn issued instructions to the Government Printer and the Public Librarian to supply the Governor with Eucalyptographia (P84/2920, P84/2922, P84/3308, P84/3326, unit 41, VPRS 1163, Public Record Office, Victoria).
See also M to R. Wadsworth, 13 May 1885 (in this edition as 85-05-13a).
